messageBody:
Although, the limitation of this strategy is that it presumes separate
source directories for chunks of the system, and the granularity of
"mocking" is at the directory level. In other words, once the mocked
source directory precludes the real source directory, all mocked classes
in that directory preclude their real peers. The same issues may be
evident using a class loader, perhaps.

Mike


Mike Clark wrote:

> Just an observation, but it seems that option 6 could be achieved simply
> by placing the mock classes in a separate, but parallel, package
> directory structure as the "real" classes and then placing the mock
> directory structure ahead of the real directory structure in the CLASSPATH.
>
> For example...
>
> /projects/src/com/xyz/
> /projects/src/mock/com/xyz/
>
> CLASSPATH=/projects/src/mock:/projects/src
>
> From the perspective of the classloader, the mock objects *are* the
> real objects.
>
> Mike
